definition: owner/master/host/individual or party concerned/God/Lord/main/to indicate or signify/trump card (in card games)

sentences.english: "It scared the living daylights out of slave holders in the West," he said.
sentences.chinese: “這種儀式會將西部的奴隸主作爲活祭品，”他說。

sentences.english: Beekeepers will naturally deny that they are slave owners who steal the products of the
sentences.chinese: 養蜂人自然會否認自己是偷蜜蜂勞動產品的奴隸主。

sentences.english: Slaves were made to work all day and all night by slave-owners.
sentences.chinese: 奴隸們被奴隸主強迫整日整夜工作。

sentences.english: Masters sometimes allowed their slaves to buy their way out of bondage.
sentences.chinese: 奴隸主們有時允許奴隸爲自己贖身。

sentences.english: The slaves writhed under the master's whip.
sentences.chinese: 奴隸們被奴隸主的皮鞭打得在地上打滾。

sentences.english: The slaveholders themselves acknowledge it in the enactment of laws for their government.
sentences.chinese: 奴隸主們在實施他們政府的法律時都承認了這一點。

sentences.english: That slave owner bought a slave in the market with little money.
sentences.chinese: 那個奴隸主沒花多少錢就在市場上買了一個娃子。

sentences.english: The fact is Dalai Lama is a slaveholder.
sentences.chinese: 事實是達賴喇嘛本身就是一個奴隸主。

sentences.english: Even some people think that he was a representative of the slave owners, who carried out a policy of obscurantism .
sentences.chinese: 還有人認爲他是奴隸主的代表，推行的是愚民政策。

sentences.english: Under such kind of background, female slaves were only the producing machines of the slave owners.
sentences.chinese: 在當時的時代背景下，女奴只是奴隸主的繁殖工具。

sentences.english: Slave-owners made slaves work all day and all night.
sentences.chinese: 奴隸們被奴隸主強迫整日整夜工作。

sentences.english: There were no more masters of the sword.
sentences.chinese: 再也沒有握着刀子的奴隸主了。

sentences.english: This guy, Bill, is the slave owner, right?
sentences.chinese: 這個被稱爲“比爾“的人是奴隸主？

sentences.english: By the late eighteenth century, however, some southern slaveholders began to have doubts.
sentences.chinese: 但到18世紀後期，一些南方奴隸主開始有懷疑。
